properties.Name: Red Line
properties.Notes: Funded under Gov O'Malley, received federal New Starts grant; cancelled by Gov Hogan due to costs.

properties.Name: Red Line Extension
properties.Notes: Additional extension would have run to Rte 128. Cancelled by local opposition in Arlington.

properties.Name: Red/Blue Connector
properties.Notes: Subject to EIS in 2010; cancelled by Gov Patrick; was required as part of Big Dig settlement.

properties.Name: N Train to LaGuardia
properties.Notes: Endorsed by Mayor Giuliani and Bloomberg; included in 2000-2004 MTA  plan; cancelled due to funding.

properties.Name: Mid-City Transitway
properties.Notes: Project would have run in alignment of proposed, cancelled Crosstown Expressway; not in plans today.

properties.Name: Circle Line Phase 2
properties.Notes: Project would extend Pink Line to Orange Line; studied by CTA in 2000s; no longer in official plans.

properties.Name: Circle Line Phase 3
properties.Notes: Project would connect Pink/Green with Blue, Red Lines; studied by CTA; no longer in official plans.

properties.Name: Central Area Circulator
properties.Notes: Cancelled after state government removed funding for project, which had been fully funded.

properties.Name: Central Area Circulator
properties.Notes: Cancelled after state government removed funding for project, which had been fully funded.

properties.Name: BART Marin Line
properties.Notes: Cancelled after Marin County voted against joining BART system.

properties.Name: Forward Thrust N-S Line
properties.Notes: Federally funded transit referendum would have supported major rail across region; referendum failed

properties.Name: Forward Thrust NE Line
properties.Notes: Federally funded transit referendum would have supported major rail across region; referendum failed

properties.Name: Forward Thrust E Line
properties.Notes: Federally funded transit referendum would have supported major rail across region; referendum failed

properties.Name: Forward Thrust N Line
properties.Notes: Federally funded transit referendum would have supported major rail across region; referendum failed

properties.Name: Orange Line North
properties.Notes: Line would have carried 23000 daily riders; cancelled due to lack of funding.

properties.Name: Orange Line West
properties.Notes: Cancelled due to lack of funding and low expected ridership.

properties.Name: Providence Streetcar
properties.Notes: Cancelled due to cost and ridership uncertainty; replaced by bus project.

properties.Name: San Antonio Streetcar
properties.Notes: Despite full local and state funding committed, significant opposition caused project cancellation.

properties.Name: Fort Worth Streetcar
properties.Notes: Despite federal grant, local opposition to project resulted in cancellation before studies completed

properties.Name: The AMP
properties.Notes: Opposition from West End section of city, funded by Koch Brothers, brought down project.

properties.Name: I-71 Corridor
properties.Notes: Part of MetroMoves major transit plan for Cincinnati region; lost in major referendum in 2002.

properties.Name: Cincinnati Subway
properties.Notes: Project began construction between 1920-1925, and elements remain, but project was abandoned.

properties.Name: Green Line Monorail
properties.Notes: Voters decided in a 2005 referendum not to fund the project; project initially approved in 1997.

properties.Name: Flying U Queen St Subway
properties.Notes: Project was to provide subway service for city's streetcars. Abandoned in favor of Bloor St Line.

properties.Name: Woodward Subway
properties.Notes: Federal government committed to $600 m for region, but plans never final; funding revoked by Reagan.

properties.Name: Austin Light Rail
properties.Notes: Project went through a variety of routing ideas. Lost 2000 funding referendum; 37,400 daily riders

properties.Name: Austin Light Rail
properties.Notes: Project went through a variety of routing ideas. Lost 2000 funding referendum; 37,400 daily riders

properties.Name: Roosevelt Boulevard Subwa
properties.Notes: Project would have extended Broad Street Line; station was built at Roosevelt and Adams.

properties.Name: Waterfront Transit
properties.Notes: Project was proposed and entered into federal process; funding difficulties meant project abandoned.

properties.Name: Waterfront Transit
properties.Notes: Project was proposed and entered into federal process; funding difficulties meant project abandoned.

properties.Name: Nostrand Line
properties.Notes: Proposed as part of Program for Action, $2.9 b improvement plan; abandoned due to lack of funds.
